description.narrative: The multi-year programmatic initiative supports capacity building for Zimbabwe Electoral Commission (ZEC), strengthening of voter registration, developing of a robust voter education programme and effective ZEC engagement with election stakeholders.

participating-org.narrative: US International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs

activity-description.narrative: Enhanced participation in the electoral process, and voter education
Enhanced participation in the electoral process, and voter education
Enhanced participation in the electoral process, and voter education

description.narrative: seat of a first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Enhanced participation in the electoral process, and voter education
Enhanced participation in the electoral process, and voter education
Enhanced participation in the electoral process, and voter education

description.narrative: 1.1 ZEC Strategic Plan 2016-2020 developed and operationalized 1.2 Needs assessment undertaken of the Commission 1.3 At least 30 ZEC offices constructed across the country by end of the project 2.1 Sustainable Voter Registration Option agreed by all Stakeholders 2.2. ICT needs assessment undertaken and documented 3.1 Voter Education and Public Outreach Plan 3.2 # of road shows and public events 3.3 Stakeholder engagement plan 3.4 ZEC's Gender Policy

comment.narrative: 1.1 ZEC SP 2010-15 but no M&E System and Data Management Systems 1.2 N/A 1.3. Provincial Offices owned by ZEC 2.1 Pilot project on voter registration for Marondera Constituency resulted in a Manual Registration process 2.2. ICT Infrastructure without VR Capacity 3.1 No existing collaboration strategy, monitoring reports 3.2 N/A 3.3 Adhoc meetings by ZEC with electoral stakeholders and MPLC meetings during elections 3.4 No gender policy in ZEC and no women specific voter education events

1.1 Development of updated ZEC five-year strategic plan for 2019-2023 1.2 a. At least 2 exchange visits to EMBs for understanding results management systems 1.2 b. A research paper developed based on experiences of countries in the region and globally 1.2 c: Support ZEC to implement recommendations of Corporate governance workshop held in 2017 1.3.a. Development of polling staff training strategy, training manuals, participant handbooks and training materials. 1.3.b Two workshops for training of training of facilitators 1.3.c Development of media monitoring regulations through provision of technical support 1.3.d Development of Enterprise Resource Planning system and revision of ZEC procedures 2.1.a. Cleaning of voters roll and experimenting with pilot test of geo-coordinates 2.1.b. Conduct training for 100 VR staff on managing and updating the voters roll 2.2.a. Training of 20 ZEC staff on managing VR related ICT capacities 3.1 Development of voter education plan and materials based on consultation with electoral stakeholders 3.2.a. Training of Master Trainers on VE conducted 3.2.b. Establishment of knowledge and information management centre 3.3.a Review of communication and engagement strategy through a consultative process 3.3.b: Stakeholder consultation meetings provide forum for discussion 3.3.c Strengthen Independent Commissions monitoring related to election 3.4 a. Developing of the ZEC Gender policy 3.4 b. Conduct post-election survey on gender in election

1.1 Enhanced ZEC planning capacity to prepare for 2023 Harmonized elections 1.2 a. Improved understanding of results management systems based on the study visits 1.2 b.Deeper understanding of the results management system based on the regional and global analysis 1.2 c: Improved corporate governance within ZEC 1.3.a. Enhanced and longer term capacity within ZEC for electoral training 1.3.b Developing a pool of BRIDGE certified trainers within ZEC 1.3.c Effective media monitoring regulations enable ZEC to better undertake media monitoring 1.3.d Improved ZEC internal control framework, procedures and processes 2.1.a. Clean and accurate voters roll 2.1.b. Improved capacity of BVR Operators to register eligible citizens as voters 2.2.a. Enhanced capacity of ICT department to manage the voters roll 3.1 Improved and advanced voter education plan and materials for undertaking continuous voter education 3.2.a. Enhanced capacity of voter educators for effective implementation of voter education campaigns 3.2.b. Knowledge and information management centre used as a hub of information 3.3.a Improved ZEC public communication and outreach 3.3.b: Dialogue and discussion with stakeholders improves ZEC credibility 3.3.c Effective collaboration among Chapter 12 Institutions leading to democratic strengthening 3.4 a. Effective measures put in place for gender mainstreaming through Gender and Inclusion policy 3.4 b. Citizens feedback improves ZEC engagement with stakeholders and citizens

Indicator 1.1.1.a: Action Plan and Monitoring Plan for Strategic Plan in place; Baseline: neither action plan nor monitoring plan; Target: yes Indicator 1.2.1.a: Needs assessment report circulated; Baseline: no report; Target: yes Indicator 1.2.2.a: Paper on options to frame delimitation taken into account by ZEC; Baseline: no paper; Target: yes Indicator 1.2.3.a: Key ZEC staff able to work from home; Baseline: no provisions; Target: 16 key staff equipped to work from home Indicator 1.2.3.b: ZEC able to organize online consultations; Baseline: no; Target: ZEC able to organize meetings and webinars with up to 100 participants on Zoom Indicator 1.2.4.a: ZEC has all necessary information on international electoral practices and access to networks, especially on new and emerging issues; Baseline: yes; Target: yes Indicator 1.3.1.a: ZEC has a sustainable professional developement strategy; Baseline: no; Target: yes Indicator 1.3.1.b: Number of accredited ZEC BRIDGE accrediting facilitators; Baseline: 0; Target: 3 [Original target, cannot be achieved during the pandemic] Indicator 1.3.1.c: Number of accredited ZEC BRIDGE workshop facilitators; Baseline: 3; Target: 9 (tbc) [Original target, cannot be achieved during the pandemic] Indicator 1.3.1.d: Number of locally customized BRIDGE modules; Baseline: 0; Target: 3 (tbc) Indicator 1.3.2.a: Media monitoring plan in place; Baseline: no plan; Target: yes Indicator 1.3.2.b: ZEC staff trained on media monitoring; Baselilne: 0; Target: 10 (tbc) Indicator 1.3.2.c: ZEC has a media monitoring unit; Baseline: no; Target: yes Indicator 1.3.3.a: ZEC has enterprise resource system; Baseline: no; Target: yes Indicator 1.3.4.a: Updated police training handbooks are distributed to relevant units; Baseline: draft handbook to be updated according to current law; Target: 1,000 copied distributed (tbc) Indicator 2.2.1.a: Data centre voter registration software is fully licensed and up to date; Baseline: software in place but needs update; Target: yes Indicator 2.3.1.a: ZEC ICT staff is fully trained and certified to operate voter registration database and software; Baseline: ICT infrastructure in place but no VR capacity; Target: 20 staff Indicator 2.3.2.a: ZEC voter registration software is capable of handling the boundary delimitation process; Baseline: capability to be determined depending on process adopted; Target: yes Indicator 3.1.1.a: Updated voter education material, included for Covid-19 policy, developed in consultation; Baseline: VE material in place but not up to date; Target: yes (number tbd) Indicator 3.2.1.a: Partnership with universities for long-term voter education in place; Baseline: no such partnership; Target: Agreements signed with five universities Indicator 3.2.1.b: Content for voter education through universities produced in consultation; Baseline: reference materials available, no dedicated content designed; Target: package approved Indicator 3.2.1.c: Online delivery mechanism for voter education through universities conceptualized; Baseline: no such mechanism or concept; Target: Detailed concept ready for contracting Indicator 3.2.2.a: Voter profile established; Baseline: Data exists in ZEC district offices but not exploited; Target: Study completed Indicator 3.2.3.a: Voter education on Covid-19 policy conducted; Baseline: No Covid-19 policy; Target: At least 40 percent of male and female voters aware of policy; 75 percent of male and female voters in by election constituencies Indicator 3.3.1.a: ZEC proposal for Electoral Act amendment submitted to Parliament; Baseline: no ZEC proposal; Target: yes Indicator 3.3.2.a: ZEC consultations with electoral stakeholders; Baseline: consultations conducted in preparation of elections; Target: 90 percent of relevant stakeholders agree that they were consulted on all key electoral issues (Covid-19 policy, reform, delimitation) Indicator 3.3.3.a: Review and development of ZEC PR strategy; Baseline: no such strategy; Target: Strategy document endorsed by ZEC Indicator 3.3.3.b: Training of ZEC staff on public relations management; Baseline: no training conducted; Target: 20 ZEC staff trained (tbc) Indicator 3.4.1.a: ZEC gender inclusion policy is being implemented; Baseline: policy is in place; Target: implementation of the policy is on track Indicator 3.4.1.b: Post-election survey report on gender in election disseminated; Baseline: Report completed; Target: Report disseminated to 90% of relevant stakeholders (tbc) Indicator 3.4.1.c: Chapter 12 platform created; Baseline and target (tbc)

1.1.1.a: not achieved, necessary consultations could not be held due to COVID-19 pandemic, to be conducted in 2021 1.2.1.a: achieved, report circulated to interested stakeholders 1.2.2.a: ongoing, discussions on options started between ZEC and international expert, training module customized, to be continued in 2021 1.2.3.a: achieved, number expanded to 31 ZEC staff equipped 1.2.3.b: achieved, Zoom licenses provided, four trainings conducted, two stakeholder interactions organized 1.2.4.a: achieved, CTA deployed 1.3.1.a: not achieved, necessary consultations could not be held nor consultants deployed, to be reprogrammed to 2021 1.3.1.b: partially achieved: 2 accrediting facilitators and 1 on track to be accredited to that level in 2021 1.3.1.c: partially achieved: ZEC still has 3 BRIDGE workshop facilitators but 20 additional staff members completed train-the-facilitator course and many of them are expected to be accredited once BRIDGE workshops can be run 1.3.1.d: partially achieved: the 2 most urgent modules customized, more to be customized in 2021 1.3.2.a: ongoing: draft submitted, to be continued in 2021 1.3.2.b: achieved, 10 staff trained (tbc) 1.3.2.c: ongoing, concept submitted, to be continued in 2021 1.3.3.a: ongoing, ZEC completed procurement but deployment is to be completed 1.3.4.a: ongoing, review of three handbooks completed, two still await ISBN number, printing of third is underway 2.2.1.a: ongoing, UNDP procurement underway 2.3.1.a: ongoing, two courses completed and exams taken, one course completed but exams outstanding, one course ongoing 2.3.2.a: not achieved as boundary delimitation process needs to be determined. To be conducted in 2021 3.1.1.a: partially achieved: voter education material updated at the beginning of the year, COVID-19 update postponed to 2021 when by-elections were suspended 3.2.1.a: not achieved: discussions were started but suspended during the pandemic, to be started again in 2021 3.2.1.b: not achieved as discussions with universities were not completed 3.2.1.c: not achieved as discussions with universities were not completed, broader concept for online voter education application is being conceptualized and will be implemented in 2021 3.2.2.a: ongoing: data collected from district offices but yet to be data entered and analysis conducted 3.2.3.a: not achieved as voter education efforts were postponed to 2021 when by-elections were suspended 3.3.1.a achieved, draft amendment bill submitted and being reviewed by Cabinet 3.3.2.a: ongoing: with by-elections suspended, only limited consultations held (voter education stakeholders and media, no survey conducted 3.3.3.a: ongoing: draft submitted, yet to be endorsed by ZEC 3.3.3.b: achieved: 20 (tbc) staff trained 3.4.1.a: ongoing: dissemination roll-out started with training of gender focal points and action plan formulated, implementation severely impacted by COVID-19 pandemic 3.4.1.b: to be started (tbc) 3.2.1.c: not achieved, to be implemented in 2021

1.2.a. Needs Assessment Report for the Commission 1.2 b. At least 2 exchange visits in International Conferences and other EMBs 1.2 c: Support ZEC to implement recommendations of Corporate governance workshop held in 2017 1.3.a. Development of polling staff training strategy, planning and training materials. 1.3.b Conduct TOT for 140 master trainers of polling staff, train 420 CEOs/DCEOs who will cascade to 14,000 WEOs/DWEOs and 100,000 polling staff. 1.3.c Development and printing of training materials for political party agents 1.3.d Development of media monitoring tools and staff training 1.3.e Conduct capacity training workshop for ZEC Finance staff 1.3.f Conduct Elections logistics training for ZEC admin and logistics staff 1.3.g Develop Admin, Procurement and Finance Enterprise Resource Planning system 1.3.h: Establish and Train ZEC training department staff 1.3.i: People with disabilities supported for improved access to polling stations 1.3.j Procure Polling Station materials for 11,000 polling stations and facilities for people with disabilities 2.1.a. The Voters Roll has integrity because of no duplicates on the list (On-going) 2.1.b Procurement and installation of BVR deduplication hardware & software(AFIS) 2.1.c Voters roll is provided in hard and soft form to political parties and other stakeholders and put up for inspection (after the new VR is completed) 2.1.d. Conduct training for the new VR staff on managing and updating the voters roll 2.2.a. Procurement of data centre software and licences 2.2.b: Connectivity to district offices and upgradation of network at HQ 3.1 Development of voter education campaign and materials based on consultation with electoral stakeholders. 3.2 a. TV/Radio infomercials and radio PSAs produced with airing of radio PSAs 3.2.b. Development, of VE content, design and printing of, 650,000 posters, 10,000 stickers. 3.2.c. Organizing and conduct 77 road shows to mobilize eligible voter. 3.2.d Maintain already established call centre 3.2.e. Reached out to the populace through social media platforms, bulk SMS 3.2 f. Install 60 billboards Country wide 3.2.g. Training of Master Trainers on VE conducted 3.2.h. Establishment of knowledge and information management centre 3.3.a: Multi-party liaison committee conflict management, mediation, dispute resolution trainings and review of EDR recommendations 3.3.b Training of ZEC staff on conflict management, mediation and dispute resolution 3.3.c Strengthen Independent Commissions including ZHRC on human rights monitoring related to election 3.3.d Conduct nationwide surveys to assess citizen knowledge/understanding of electoral processes 3.4 a. Developing of the ZEC Gender policy 3.4 b. Conduct post-election survey on gender in election. 3.4 c. Gender and elections BRIDGE training 3.4 d: Voter education for gender mainstreaming

1.2.a. Effective Corporate Governance structures and systems put in place to improve performance of ZEC 1.2.b. Promoting concept of "Sustaining Peace through Elections", with two ZEC officials attending the 2018 Joint EU-UNDP Global Conference on "Sustaining Peace Through Elections" in Brussels 8-10 October 2018 and shared Zimbabwe case study on Bio-metric Voter Registration with other Election Management Bodies 1.2.b. Enhanced learning of results management system with two ZEC officials on an exchange visit/election monitoring mission to DRC 12-27 December 2018 used for studying the results management system enabling ZEC to develop a new system for Zimbabwe 1.2.c. Ensuring transparency in ZEC's work through implementation of recommendations of Corporate Governance 1.3.a. Improved polling procedures translating into transparency in the polling process through development of polling staff training handbook and video used in 2018 Elections. 1.3.b. Training electoral staff for effective and improved management of election process in a transparent manner 1.3.c. Enhancing capacity of political parties in oversight of election process by provision of polling handbook and video that were used effectively to train political party agents 1.3.d. Improved media monitoring by ZEC using statistical analysis and reports produced by a ful;ly equipped and trained Media monitoring unit 1.3.e. Improved budget and financial management of 2018 harmonized elections through training of 54 ZEC Finance staff 1.3.f. This was not conducted 1.3.g. Improved administrative and financial management through implementation of Enterprise Resource Planning system was developed and being used at the Headquarters level 1.3.h. Enhanced capacity of ZEC staff through technical support to develop training materials and used as master trainers 1.3.i. Improved access to people with disabilities using shorter heights for the polling booths in all polling stations 1.3.j. Improved transparency and administration of polling process through 11,000 polling stations kits that met international standards 2.1.a. A credible, accurate and inclusive Biometric Voters Roll with 5.69 million, 44% youth and 54% women with independent certification from Zimbabwe Election Support Network confirming its credibility 2.1.b. Effective de-duplication process ensured there are no duplicate registrants using the Automated Finger Print Identification System (AFIS) hardware and software 2.1.c. Improved transparency in the voter registration system through provision of Voter’s roll in soft copy to political parties and stakeholders 2.1.d. Enhanced capacity of ZEC staff to manage and updating voters roll and produce reports 2.2.a Improved software capability for the generation of reports and regular maintenance of voter registration data 2.2.b. Establishing connectivity and communication with district offices using government resources 3.1. An inclusive, creative and innovative voter education campaign having a national outreach in partnership with CSOs 3.2.a. Extensive voter education resulting in an 85% voter turn out through Radio and TV advertisements, 4 Dramas in 12 languages aired on 14 radio stations and 1 television station, face to face outreach through 10,000 voter educators 3.2.b. Effective and informed messages reaching out nationally mobilized the voters for high voter turn out using also print media developed through 600,000 posters, 100,00 stickers, leaflets etc 3.2.c. Mobilization of youth and women through face to face communication using seventy-seven Road shows countrywide that directly and indirectly reached out to 100,000 people 3.2.d. Effective two way communication between ZEC and citizens resulted in increased confidence through a Call centre information citizens on BVR, inspection, candidate nomination and polling. 3.2.e. Enhanced outreach to citizens through creative means using 11,800,000 SMSs messages with information on voter registration, inspection, polling and information on their polling stations. Twitter and Facebook used by ZEC to reach out to youth during the elections 3.2.f. More informed citizens on election processes through 60 Bill boards installed in the 10 provinces with an outreach of 60,000 3.2.g. Handbook for training of voter educators was developed and ZEC staff trained to roll out the training to the voter educators 3.2.h. This was not established and is now planned for next year 3.3.a. Regular multi party liaison committees were organized at national and provincial levels that addressed issues of politically motivated violence and addressed conflicts among political parties. This was supported by EISA 3.3.b. Strengthened capacity of ZEC staff for conflict management, mediation and dispute resolution through effective training 3.3.c. Enhanced capacity of Zimbabwe Human Rights Commission through strategy planning on election monitoring and its effective implementation through pre-election, election day and post election statements and addressing human rights complaints during these periods 3.3.d. Informed messages and campaign materials on gender for 2018 harmonized elections by using the gender baseline survey information 3.4.a. An inclusive process for development of gender policy was started with training of 40 participants in Gender Policy development workshop from 3-5 October 2018 and appointment of gender focal points 3.4.b. Development of baseline for 2023 elections through conducting of post-election survey 3.4.c. Enhanced capacity of ZEC gender focal points to lead the gender mainstreaming process through Gender and Election BRIDGE training for 35 participants 3.4.d. Engendered voter education messages and materials produced that targeted women voters. A Women’s Vote campaign was developed, and 50 000 posters printed, and Billboards erected

Indicator 1.1.1.a: Software for monitoring the implementation of Strategic Plan is deployed and used; Baseline: no such software exists; Target: software deployed and data effectively disseminated to all concerned Indicator 1.1.2.a: Operational plan for delimitation in place; Baseline: no such plan; Target: yes Indicator 1.2.1.a: Key ZEC staff able to work from home; Baseline: Baseline: 31 key staff equipped to work from home; Target: 31 Indicator 1.2.2.a: Detailed technical proposal for results system submitted to Commission; Baselilne: No such proposal; Target: yes Indicator 1.2.3.a: ZEC has all necessary information on international electoral practices and access to networks; Baseline: yes; Target: yes Indicator 1.3.1.a: Number of participants completing workshops: Baseline: (tba); Target: (baseline+170) Indicator 1.3.1.b: Percentage of participants who say that the learning will help them miprove their work; Baseline: not measured; Target: at least 75%; Indicator 1.3.1.c: Number of accredited ZEC BRIDGE accrediting facilitators; Baseline: 2; Target: 3 Indicator 1.3.1.d: Number of accredited ZEC BRIDGE workshop facilitators; Baseline: 3; Target: 12 (tbc) Indicator 1.3.1.e: Number of locally customized BRIDGE modules; Baseline: 2; Target: 5 (tbc) Indicator 1.3.2.a: Concept and materials for virtual delivery of BRIDGE; Baseline: no such concept; Target: Delivery mechansim conceptualized and piloted and content for two modules ready Indicator 2.1.1.a: All necessary voter registration software and warranties are current; Baseline: some licenses missing and warranties expired; Target: 100% of required software in place with necessary warranties current Indicator 2.1.2.a: Data centre fully operational; Baseline: Yes, but risks of fire and power cuts not fully mitigated; Target: Yes with risks of fire and power cuts mitigated. Indicator 2.1.3.a: Percentage of ZEC offices conducting voter registration that are connected to the Internet; Baseline: 100%; Target 100% (five new offices to be connected) Indicator 2.1.4.a: Staff trained for massive voter registration exercice in under-registered areas; Baseline: last staff training conducted in 2017; Target: All necessary staff fully trained [numbers to be added] Indicator 2.2.1.a: ICT staff fully trained for data centre management, including threat control: Baseline [tbc]; Target: Sufficient staff fully trained to ensure safe and continued operation of data centre [number to be added] Indicator 2.2.2.a: Required staff for handling voter registration data for boundary delimitation fully trained; Baseline: no such training conducted; Required staff fully trained [number to be added] Indicator 2.3.1.a: A voter registration plan is in place to meet all the requirements for by-elections and the boundary delimitation; Baseline: no such plan exisits and not all aspects of VR use in boundary delimitation are clear; Target: plan adopted by ZEC Indicator 2.3.2.b: Targets and timeline of the voter registration and delimitation plans are met; Baseline: no plans in place; Target: 100% of targets met on time Indicator 3.1.1.a: Updated voter education material, especially for voter registration and boundary delimitation, developed in consultation; Baseline: VE material in place but not up to date; Target: yes (number tbd) Indicator 3.2.1.a: Partnership with universities for long-term voter education started; Baseline: discussions held but no partnerships started; Target: Concept approved and agreements signed with at least five universities Indicator 3.2.1.b: Voter education through universities implemented; Baseline: concept ready; Target: 500 students reached (tbc) Indicator 3.2.2.a: Voter profiling analysis completed; Baseline: raw data collected in hardcopies; Target: Analytical report finalized with at least five distinct, novel and relevant recommendations for ZEC voter education and/or voter registration Indicator 3.2.3.a: Voter education application developed and deployed; Baseline: no such application; Target: android application available in Play Store Indicator 3.2.4.a: Voter education chatbot developed and deployed; Baseline: no such chatbot; Target: chatbot operational and at least 500 queries answered Indicator 3.2.5.a: Percentage of citizens informed on voter registration, boundary delimitation and the Covid-19 policy; Baseline: delimitation: 16.5% (ZESN), no voter education conducted on boundary delimitation and Covid-19 policy; Target: 60% (tbc) in relevant target areas; Source: dedicated survey Indicator 3.2.5.b: Percentage of women informed on voter registration, boundary delimitation and the Covid-19 policy; Baseline: unknown, no voter education conducted on boundary delimitation and Covid-19 policy; Target: 60% (tbc) in relevant target areas; Source: dedicated survey Indicator 3.3.2.a: ZEC consultations with electoral stakeholders; Baseline: unknown; Target: 90% of key stakeholders agree that they were informed and/or consulted on key issues (voter registration, delimitation, reform) Indicator 3.3.3.a: New image launched; Baseline: ZEC image remains an issue of concern; Target: New communications kit, logo, website, social media interaction and outreach and transparency practices implemented Indicator 3.3.3.b: Image of ZEC improved; Baseline: uncertain; Target: Ten percent of respondents say they have a better image of ZEC than a year before; Means: perception survey (tbc) Indicator 3.4.1.a: ZEC gender inclusion policy is being implemented; Baseline: ZEC gender focal points trained on the policy, action plan formulated; Target: action plan adopted and implementation on track Indicator 3.4.2.a: Exchanges among Chapter 12 institutions enhanced; Baseline: platform established; Target: 80% of institutions say that they have been sufficiently consulted on election issues that relate to their mandates Indicator 3.4.3.a: Disabled Persons Organization consulted on the implementation of key electoral activities, notably voter registration, by-elections and delimitation, and their input taken into account as much as possible; Baseline and target (tbc)
